item.title: Analysis of 'Gapminder unemployment 15+' dataset
item.description: library(dplyr) ## Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 3.4.2 ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) ## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.4.3 library(tidyr) ## Warning: package 'tidyr' was built under R version 3.4.2 #Importing data into R une_15 <- read.

item.title: Suicides In India-Kaggle Dataset
item.description: library(ggplot2) library(gridExtra) library(ggthemes) library(dplyr) library(tidyr) library(reshape2) library(data.table) sui <- read.csv("D:/DataSets/Practice datasets/suicides_in_India.csv") sui_cleaned <- sui[which(sui$State!="Total (All India)" & sui$State!="Total(Uts)" & sui$State!="Total (States)") & sui$Age_group!= "0-100+", ] Grouping the data by “state” and “year” sui_1 <- sui_cleaned %>% group_by(State,Year) %>% summarise(total=sum(Total)) Creating a new varibale called “growth rate”.This’ll give the change in number of suicide cases YOY for each state. sui_2<- mutate(sui_1,gowth_rate_yoy=(total/lag(total)-1)) #Removing the details for Lakshadweep,as it contain 'inf' and 'NaN' sui_2n <- sui_2[-c(217:228), ] Generating line graph for YOY growth rate
